articles.title: Microsoft has another go at closing security hole exploited by Magniber ransomware

title_detail.value: Microsoft has another go at closing security hole exploited by Magniber ransomware

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
In its latest Patch Tuesday bundle of security fixes, Microsoft has patched a security flaw that was being used by the Magniber cybercrime gang to help them infect computers with ransomware.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

summary_detail.value:
In its latest Patch Tuesday bundle of security fixes, Microsoft has patched a security flaw that was being used by the Magniber cybercrime gang to help them infect computers with ransomware.

articles.title: STALKER 2 hacker demands Ukrainian game developer reinstates Russian language support, or else…

title_detail.value: STALKER 2 hacker demands Ukrainian game developer reinstates Russian language support, or else…

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary: A Ukrainian video game developer has revealed that a hacker has leaked development material stolen from the company's systems, and is threatening to release tens of gigabytes more if their unorthodox ransom demands are not met.

summary_detail.value: A Ukrainian video game developer has revealed that a hacker has leaked development material stolen from the company's systems, and is threatening to release tens of gigabytes more if their unorthodox ransom demands are not met.

articles.title: FBI reveals that more money is lost to investment fraud than ransomware and business email compromise combined

title_detail.value: FBI reveals that more money is lost to investment fraud than ransomware and business email compromise combined

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
The latest annual FBI report on the state of cybercrime has shown a massive increase in the amount of money stolen through investment scams.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

summary_detail.value:
The latest annual FBI report on the state of cybercrime has shown a massive increase in the amount of money stolen through investment scams.

articles.title: WhatsApp and UK government on collision course, as app vows not to remove end-to-end encryption

title_detail.value: WhatsApp and UK government on collision course, as app vows not to remove end-to-end encryption

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
The boss of WhatsApp, the most popular messaging platform in the UK, says that it will not remove end-to-end encryption from the app to comply with requirements set out in the UK government's online safety bill.

Learn more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

summary_detail.value:
The boss of WhatsApp, the most popular messaging platform in the UK, says that it will not remove end-to-end encryption from the app to comply with requirements set out in the UK government's online safety bill.

Learn more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

articles.title: Pirated copies of Final Cut Pro infect Macs with cryptojacking malware

title_detail.value: Pirated copies of Final Cut Pro infect Macs with cryptojacking malware

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary: Torrents on The Pirate Bay which claim to contain Final Cut Pro are instead being used to distribute cryptojacking malware to Macs.

articles.title: TSA tells US aviation industry to boost its cybersecurity

title_detail.value: TSA tells US aviation industry to boost its cybersecurity

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
The US Transportation and Security Administration (TSA) has issued new requirements for airport and aircraft operators who, they say, are facing a "persistent cybersecurity threat."

Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

articles.title: Smashing Security podcast #312: Super grannies, bar trolls, and US Marshals

title_detail.value: Smashing Security podcast #312: Super grannies, bar trolls, and US Marshals

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Scammers get pwned by a Canadian granny! Don't be seduced in a bar by an iPhone thief! And will the US Marshals be able to track down the villains who stole their data?

All this and much much more is discussed in the latest edition of the "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault, joined this week by Anna Brading.

Plus don’t miss our featured interview with Jason Meller of Kolide.

articles.title: Vice Society publishes data stolen during Vesuvius ransomware attack

title_detail.value: Vice Society publishes data stolen during Vesuvius ransomware attack

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary: A notorious ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyber attack against Vesuvius, the London Stock Exchange-listed molten metal flow engineering company.

summary_detail.value: A notorious ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyber attack against Vesuvius, the London Stock Exchange-listed molten metal flow engineering company.

articles.title: Trezor crypto wallets under attack in SMS phishing campaign

title_detail.value: Trezor crypto wallets under attack in SMS phishing campaign

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Willie Sutton, the criminal who became legendary for stealing from banks during a forty year career, was once asked, "Why do you keep robbing banks?"

His answer? "Because that's where the money is."

However, today there's a better target for robbers today than banks, which are typically well-defended against theft...

Cryptocurrency wallets.

Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

summary_detail.value:

articles.title: WH Smith investigates hacking attack after employee data stolen

title_detail.value: WH Smith investigates hacking attack after employee data stolen

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary: British high street giant WH Smith has revealed that it has suffered a "cybersecurity incident," which has seen hackers gain unauthorised access to its systems, and steal data including information related to current and former employees.

summary_detail.value: British high street giant WH Smith has revealed that it has suffered a "cybersecurity incident," which has seen hackers gain unauthorised access to its systems, and steal data including information related to current and former employees.

articles.title: Indigo Books & Music refuses to pay ransom after hackers stole employee information

title_detail.value: Indigo Books & Music refuses to pay ransom after hackers stole employee information

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Following what it called a "cybersecurity incident" three weeks ago, Canadian bookstore chain Indigo has not only confirmed that it was hit by a ransomware attack, but also that data related to current and former employees was stolen by hackers.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

summary_detail.value:
Following what it called a "cybersecurity incident" three weeks ago, Canadian bookstore chain Indigo has not only confirmed that it was hit by a ransomware attack, but also that data related to current and former employees was stolen by hackers.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

articles.title: Smashing Security podcast #311: TikTok, wiretapping, and your deepfake voice is your password

title_detail.value: Smashing Security podcast #311: TikTok, wiretapping, and your deepfake voice is your password

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Who has been warning Italian criminals that their phones are wiretapped? Can you trust your voice to protect your bank account? And why is TikTok being singled out by investigators?

All this and much much more is discussed in the latest edition of the "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault, joined this week by Dinah Davis.

summary_detail.value:

articles.summary:

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

articles.title: Fake ChatGPT apps spread Windows and Android malware

title_detail.value: Fake ChatGPT apps spread Windows and Android malware

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Malicious hackers are taking advantage of people searching the internet for free access to ChatGPT in order to direct them to malware and phishing sites.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

articles.title: Food giant Dole hit by ransomware, halts North American production temporarily

title_detail.value: Food giant Dole hit by ransomware, halts North American production temporarily

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Earlier this month a cyber attack on food produce giant Dole caused the firm to shut down its production plants across North America for a period of time, and halt shipments to stores.

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.

summary_detail.value:

articles.title: Free decryptor released for Conti-based ransomware following data leak

title_detail.value: Free decryptor released for Conti-based ransomware following data leak

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Security researchers have released a new decryption tool which should come to the rescue of some victims of a modified version of the Conti ransomware, helping them to recover their encrypted data for free.

Read more in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

summary_detail.value:

articles.title: Android phones can be hacked just by someone knowing your phone number

title_detail.value: Android phones can be hacked just by someone knowing your phone number

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Well, this isn’t good.

Google has issued a warning that some Android phones can be hacked remotely, without the intended victim having to click on anything.

title_detail.value: Smashing Security podcast #313: Tesla twins and deepfake dramas

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
The twisted tale of the two Teslas, and a deepfake sandwich.

All this and more is discussed in the latest edition of the "Smashing Security" podcast by computer security veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault.

articles.title: Smashing Security podcast #407: HP’s hold music, and human trafficking

title_detail.value: Smashing Security podcast #407: HP’s hold music, and human trafficking

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Journey with us to Myanmar's shadowy scam factories, where trafficked workers are forced to run romance-baiting and fake tech support scams, and find out why a company's mandatory hold time for tech support could lead to innocent users having their computers compromised.

All this and more is discussed in the latest edition of the "Smashing Security" podcast by cybersecurity veterans Graham Cluley and Carole Theriault.

Plus - don't miss our featured interview with Acronis CISO Gerald Beuchelt!

articles.title: Cactus ransomware: what you need to know

title_detail.value: Cactus ransomware: what you need to know

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
Cactus is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group that encrypts victim's data and demands a ransom for a decryption key.

Read more about it in my article on the Tripwire State of Security blog.

articles.title: The AI Fix #40: ChatGPT saved my life, and making evil AIs by accident

title_detail.value: The AI Fix #40: ChatGPT saved my life, and making evil AIs by accident

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
In episode 40 of the AI Fix, Graham meets a shape-shifting GOAT, a robot dog gets wet, Mark likes Claude 3.7 Sonnet, OpenAI releases its dullest model yet, Grok 3 needs to go home and have a lie down, and everyone loses their minds over two AI agents booking a hotel room using 90s-era modem dial-up sounds.

Graham tells the incredible story of a woman whose life was saved after ChatGPT told her to go to the emergency room, stat! And Mark explains how just a little negativity made GPT-4o bad to the bone.

All this and much more is discussed in the latest edition of "The AI Fix" podcast by Graham Cluley and Mark Stockley.

summary_detail.value:
In episode 40 of the AI Fix, Graham meets a shape-shifting GOAT, a robot dog gets wet, Mark likes Claude 3.7 Sonnet, OpenAI releases its dullest model yet, Grok 3 needs to go home and have a lie down, and everyone loses their minds over two AI agents booking a hotel room using 90s-era modem dial-up sounds.

Graham tells the incredible story of a woman whose life was saved after ChatGPT told her to go to the emergency room, stat! And Mark explains how just a little negativity made GPT-4o bad to the bone.

All this and much more is discussed in the latest edition of "The AI Fix" podcast by Graham Cluley and Mark Stockley.

articles.title: Stop targeting Russian hackers, Trump administration orders US Cyber Command

title_detail.value: Stop targeting Russian hackers, Trump administration orders US Cyber Command

articles.author: Graham Cluley
articles.summary:
The Trump administration has told US cyber command and CISA to stop following or reporting on Russian cyber threats.

Yes, Russia! That country everyone used to agree was home to lots of ransomware gangs and hackers. Hmmm...

Read more in my article on the Hot for Security blog.
